thread.title: ‘American Default’ Review: A New Deal for Gold

author: James Grant
title: ‘American Default’ Review: A New Deal for Gold
text:
A question interrupted a government lawyer as he made his radical argument before the Supreme Court. “In other words,” posed a voice from the bench, “can Congress act to make the dime a dollar?” Although the government, even then, was more adept at turning a dollar into a dime, the lawyer replied in the affirmative.
That exchange took place in 1935, in the midst of the famous cases concerning the government’s power to repudiate contracts known as “gold clauses.” Sebastian Edwards’s “American Default: The Untold Story of FDR,...
